title: TC01 - Network deeplink
custom_steps:
We’d like to ensure all of the current more menu links are supported in the new Browse Experience. This can include deep links to other areas in the app, launching links externally in your browser, launching webviews etc.

Acceptance Criteria

We’d like to have the following link capabilities:

Deep Link: Linking to native in app experiences (e.g.e Stats)

Web View Deep Link: Linking to a webpage without leaving the app (e.g. Baseball Savant)

Native Deep Link: Linking to native destinations within the app

custom_steps_separated.content: Open MLB app and navigate to browse menu.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Browse menu should be displayed correctly.

custom_steps_separated.content:
Click on any button that has a network deeplink.
E.G. MLB Network button.
custom_steps_separated.expected: MLB networks screen should be displayed. Also a back buttons should be displayed at the top left.

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on back button.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Browse menu should be displayed correctly.

custom_steps_separated.content:
Force quit app. Open any text editor and type mlbatbat://network. Then click on the link.
Note: Some of these deeplinks do not work on Android.
custom_steps_separated.expected: MLB networks screen should be displayed.

title: TC01 - Hot Stove - Spanish translation
custom_steps:
Scenario: Update URL For Spanish Users

GIVEN a user is using the MLB App in Spanish mode

WHEN they look at the bottom tab bar

AND Hot Stove is enabled though the OMS tool

THEN the Hot Stove destination for Spanish users will link to https://www.mlb.com/app/atbat/es/news/los-rumores-mas-recientes-del-invierno-2022-2023?t=trades-and-transactions

 

Scenario: Update Top Tool Bar Test to say Hot Stove

GIVEN a user is using the MLB App 

WHEN they navigate to the hot stove tab

THEN the top navigation tool bar will say “Hot Stove” and not “Transactions”

custom_steps_separated.content: Open MLB app, phone should be set up in Spanish
Navigate to Hot Stove page.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Hot stove page should be displayed. Validate that page is showing the content of:
https://www.mlb.com/app/atbat/es/news/los-rumores-mas-recientes-del-invierno-2022-2023?t=trades-and-transactions

custom_steps_separated.content: Validate page title.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Top navigation tool bar should say “Hot Stove” and not “Transactions”

title: Webview: Gameday deeplinks re-launch the app and reset backstack
custom_preconds: When tapping a deeplink within a webview we are relaunching the app instead of navigating directly to the destination. This causes a white screen flash as well as a reset of the backstack, so tapping system back will navigate to the start destination instead of the calling webview. This will happen for any deeplink in our webviews, an easy way to test is to tap Player links within gameday, news, stats.

title: TC19 - log out color contrast
custom_steps:
Launch the App.

Open Account Settings

Browse through the page/App until reaching the "Log Out" button.

Take a screenshot of the item, share it to the pc/mac.

Open the Colour Contrast Analyzer tool, select the dropper icon, click on the foreground section and select any pixel from the "Log Out" button.

Measure the contrast ratio between the text and the background color.
custom_expected: Make sure that the element has a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1.

title: TC05 - Browse Menu - Deep linking support
custom_preconds: User should have browse menu feature flag enabled in adobe target. Vernon Martin can help with this.
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria

We’d like to have the following link capabilities:

Deep Link: Linking to native in app experiences (e.g.e Stats)

Web View Deep Link: Linking to a webpage without leaving the app (e.g. Baseball Savant)

Native Deep Link: Linking to native destinations within the app

custom_steps_separated.expected: Browse menu page should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.expected: App should redirect user to the correct page.

custom_steps_separated.content: Kill app and open any text editor/browser. Enter the deep link URL and click go/enter.
custom_steps_separated.expected: MLB app should be opened and user should be redirected to the correct page.

/// For a MLB League team
